Operation 'post_/spins' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The current description is too generic and lacks critical details for AI agent interpretation. The improved description specifies: (1) what the operation creates, (2) expected input parameters (artist, track, album, timestamp), (3) authentication requirement, (4) response format and status code, (5) intended use case (automation systems), and (6) important side effect (immutability). This helps AI agents understand when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description: An endpoint for automation systems to log spins into the spin table.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new spin record in the spin table. Accepts spin details such as artist, track, album, and timestamp information. Requires authentication via API key. Returns the created Spin object with a 201 status code. This operation is designed for automation systems to record music plays. Note: Spin records are immutable after creation.
data.reasoning: The current description is too generic and lacks critical details for AI agent interpretation. The improved description specifies: (1) what the operation creates, (2) expected input parameters (artist, track, album, timestamp), (3) authentication requirement, (4) response format and status code, (5) intended use case (automation systems), and (6) important side effect (immutability). This helps AI agents understand when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'get_/spins/{id}' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details. data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a specific spin record by its unique identifier. Returns the complete Spin object containing details such as artist, track, album, show information, and timestamp. Requires authentication via API key. The spin ID must be a valid integer corresponding to an existing spin record.

message: Operation 'get_/personas' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, unclear_purpose, missing_output_details. Original summary is too generic. Description is completely missing. Added context about what personas represent (DJ/host identities), pagination behavior, and that one person can have multiple personas per the API schema documentation. This helps AI agents understand the resource and when to use this operation.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all Persona objects representing radio DJs/hosts. Each persona describes a unique on-air identity; one person can have multiple personas. Results are paginated with a default limit of 20 items per page (maximum 200). Supports optional filtering and sorting parameters.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description is completely missing. Added context about what personas represent (DJ/host identities), pagination behavior, and that one person can have multiple personas per the API schema documentation. This helps AI agents understand the resource and when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'get_/personas/{id}' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_context. Summary is adequate but description is missing entirely. Added information about what the operation returns, that it's a single persona lookup, and error handling. This provides AI agents with clear understanding of the operation's purpose and expected outcomes.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a single Persona object by its unique identifier. Returns the persona details including name, bio, and other metadata for the specified DJ/host identity. Returns 404 if the persona does not exist.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate but description is missing entirely. Added information about what the operation returns, that it's a single persona lookup, and error handling. This provides AI agents with clear understanding of the operation's purpose and expected outcomes.

message: Operation 'get_/playlists' has semantic quality issues: missing_context, missing_output_details. Summary is adequate. Description lacks context about what a Playlist represents in the domain, pagination behavior, and the relationship to shows/spins. Added explanation that playlists are collections of spins from show occurrences, and clarified pagination to help AI agents understand the full scope of the operation.

data.current_summary: Returns playlists optionally filtered by {start} and/or {end} datetimes
data.current_description:
Get Playlists optionally filtered by a datetime range.
Only past Playlists will be returned (with allowed tolerance equals 1 hour in future).

Ordered chronologically from newest to oldest.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of past Playlist objects optionally filtered by a datetime range. Only playlists that have already aired are returned, with a 1-hour future tolerance window. Results are ordered chronologically from newest to oldest. Supports pagination with default limit of 20 items per page (maximum 200). A Playlist represents the collection of spins (tracks played) during a show occurrence.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate. Description lacks context about what a Playlist represents in the domain, pagination behavior, and the relationship to shows/spins. Added explanation that playlists are collections of spins from show occurrences, and clarified pagination to help AI agents understand the full scope of the operation.

message: Operation 'get_/spins' has semantic quality issues: missing_context, missing_output_details. Summary is adequate but description is too brief. Missing context about what a Spin represents (individual track play), pagination behavior, and result ordering. Added explanation of the Spin domain concept and pagination details to help AI agents understand the resource and when to use this operation for music play history queries.

data.current_summary: Returns spins optionally filtered by {start} and/or {end} datetimes
data.current_description: Get Spins optionally filtered by a datetime range. Only past Spins will be returned.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of past Spin objects optionally filtered by a datetime range. Only spins (individual track plays) that have already aired are returned. Results are ordered chronologically. Supports pagination with default limit of 20 items per page (maximum 200). A Spin represents a single track played during a show, including metadata such as artist, title, album, and play timestamp.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate but description is too brief. Missing context about what a Spin represents (individual track play), pagination behavior, and result ordering. Added explanation of the Spin domain concept and pagination details to help AI agents understand the resource and when to use this operation for music play history queries.
